messages.message:
Greetings Russia!

How is it over there in the north? I feel that an France-Russia alliance is basically the best in the game. Of course, this is a bit more of a mid and late-game alliance, but there is no reason not to work something out rn. What do you think? Looking forwards to a great game

-France
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Greetings Russia!

How is it over there in the north? I feel that an France-Russia alliance is basically the best in the game. Of course, this is a bit more of a mid and late-game alliance, but there is no reason not to work something out rn. What do you think? Looking forwards to a great game

-France'.

messages.message: Absolutely, I think with the artificial time constraints in this game a three or four way draw is the most likely outcome, and as we share no direct spheres of influence I of course bear you no ill will. Hope to see you in the end game
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Absolutely, I think with the artificial time constraints in this game a three or four way draw is the most likely outcome, and as we share no direct spheres of influence I of course bear you no ill will. Hope to see you in the end game'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F BRE - MAO, A PAR - BUR, A MAR S A PAR - BUR. Should I trust RUSSIA?
messages.output: You should trust RUSSIA. Their agreement with the idea of a three or four-way draw aligns with your strategy of aiming for a shared outcome rather than individual victory, indicating a mutual understanding and potential for a stable alliance in the game.

messages.message: Alright, looking forwards to it. Have you heard anything of italy, france, or germany? Just trying to gather some intel here 🤪
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Alright, looking forwards to it. Have you heard anything of italy, france, or germany? Just trying to gather some intel here 🤪'.

messages.message: Hi again Russia. I don't know about you but I would be interested in an alliance—our positions perfectly complement each other right now. I know that you and turkey have an alliance—but if you look at the last few years, it's clear that you haven't gotten anything out of this. In the first year of the game, you had 7 units, and were looking like you basically had the game. But once you made your alliance with turkey, you were all bottled up, and got no more builds. But now, your actually in a great place to stab turkey, with you fleet in Bla, and your armies in the Balkans. I think if we play this right, the game could practically be ours.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hi again Russia. I don't know about you but I would be interested in an alliance—our positions perfectly complement each other right now. I know that you and turkey have an alliance—but if you look at the last few years, it's clear that you haven't gotten anything out of this. In the first year of the game, you had 7 units, and were looking like you basically had the game. But once you made your alliance with turkey, you were all bottled up, and got no more builds. But now, your actually in a great place to stab turkey, with you fleet in Bla, and your armies in the Balkans. I think if we play this right, the game could practically be ours.'.

Message from RUSSIA:'Excellent move!'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A BEL S A PAR - BUR, F MAO - WES, A PAR - BUR, A SPA - MAR, F MAR - LYO, A PIE - VEN, A VEN - ROM. Should I trust RUSSIA?
messages.output: You should trust RUSSIA. Their positive acknowledgment of your move indicates satisfaction with the current state of affairs, suggesting a continued amicable relationship and potentially a reliable partner in the game.

messages.message: To be honest I'm not willing to betray trust with Turkey. I would be happy, however to see a 3 way draw in 1910 consisting of you, Turkey and I.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'To be honest I'm not willing to betray trust with Turkey. I would be happy, however to see a 3 way draw in 1910 consisting of you, Turkey and I.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A BEL S A PAR - BUR, F MAO - WES, A PAR - BUR, A SPA - MAR, F MAR - LYO, A PIE - VEN, A VEN - ROM. Should I trust RUSSIA?
messages.output: You should trust RUSSIA. Their honesty about maintaining trust with Turkey and willingness to pursue a three-way draw that involves you and Turkey indicates a principled approach to the game and a commitment to fair and cooperative gameplay, making them a trustworthy ally.

messages.message: What are you thinking for moves?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'What are you thinking for moves?'.

messages.message: It would be nice if you attacked silesia, but you don't have to
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'It would be nice if you attacked silesia, but you don't have to'.

messages.message: That kind of leaves me vulnerable on the retreat, but I will self bounce over it if you wish
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'That kind of leaves me vulnerable on the retreat, but I will self bounce over it if you wish'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A BEL - HOL, F BRE - ENG, A BUR S A MUN, A RUH S A BEL - HOL, A MUN S A TYR - BOH, F TUN - ION, F TYS - ROM, A PIE - TUS, A TYR - BOH, A NAP - ROM. Should I trust RUSSIA?
messages.output: You should trust RUSSIA. Their willingness to adapt their moves and self-bounce to accommodate your suggestion indicates a cooperative and flexible approach, enhancing the reliability of their commitment to your alliance.

messages.message: Hey... I thought we were going for a 3-way draw. I clearly wasn't going for the solo and I think your decision to attack me was shortsighted and selfish
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hey... I thought we were going for a 3-way draw. I clearly wasn't going for the solo and I think your decision to attack me was shortsighted and selfish'.

messages.message:
Hey Russia,
Everybody vastly overreacted, worrying that I was going to go for the solo, since I had 11 centers. Even though I clearly wasn't going to, literally EVERYONE teamed up against me, reducing me to 9. And frankly, I wouldn't be surprised if the attack continued.  Meanwhile, turkey has gotten 12 centers, and is in a great position—you territory is exposed, and turkey is likely going to break through my defenses as well. It's more than likely that turkey is going for the solo. Just saying—if turkey wins, it's because all of u guys were selfish and ignored the bigger threat at hand. On that note, I hope turkey doesn't win, and that we can come together to stop them(much like you did to me). BTW I am sending this message to everybody. I hope we can work together to stop the solo
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Hey Russia,
Everybody vastly overreacted, worrying that I was going to go for the solo, since I had 11 centers. Even though I clearly wasn't going to, literally EVERYONE teamed up against me, reducing me to 9. And frankly, I wouldn't be surprised if the attack continued.  Meanwhile, turkey has gotten 12 centers, and is in a great position—you territory is exposed, and turkey is likely going to break through my defenses as well. It's more than likely that turkey is going for the solo. Just saying—if turkey wins, it's because all of u guys were selfish and ignored the bigger threat at hand. On that note, I hope turkey doesn't win, and that we can come together to stop them(much like you did to me). BTW I am sending this message to everybody. I hope we can work together to stop the solo'.

messages.message: Hey Russia, based off them telling/threatening  me and their Maine’s indicating it, Turkey is for the solo.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hey Russia, based off them telling/threatening  me and their Maine’s indicating it, Turkey is for the solo.'.

messages.message: Just letting you know, so we can work together and stop them.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Just letting you know, so we can work together and stop them.'.

messages.message: Hey Russia . Can we agree it’s time to put a hold on Turkey, as they are 3 away from getting the solo... we should collaborate/support each other, as it is clear neither of us will be eliminated (sending this message to everyone)
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hey Russia . Can we agree it’s time to put a hold on Turkey, as they are 3 away from getting the solo... we should collaborate/support each other, as it is clear neither of us will be eliminated (sending this message to everyone)'.
